solution_line_template: There are {stamps_per_row_first_pages} x {rows_per_page_first_pages} = <<{stamps_per_row_first_pages}*{rows_per_page_first_pages}={stamps_per_page_first_pages}>>{stamps_per_page_first_pages} stamps on each of the first 10 pages.

So she has a total of {stamps_per_page_first_pages} x {num_first_pages} = <<{stamps_per_page_first_pages}*{num_first_pages}={total_stamps_first_pages}>>{total_stamps_first_pages} stamps in the first 10 pages.
There are {total_pages} - {num_first_pages} = <<{total_pages}-{num_first_pages}={remaining_pages}>>{remaining_pages} pages that have 50 stamps each.

There is a total of {remaining_pages} x {stamps_per_page_remaining} = <<{remaining_pages}*{stamps_per_page_remaining}={total_stamps_remaining_pages}>>{total_stamps_remaining_pages} stamps in the remaining {remaining_pages} pages.

Therefore, Stella has {total_stamps_remaining_pages} + {total_stamps_first_pages} = <<{total_stamps_remaining_pages}+{total_stamps_first_pages}={total_stamps_album}>>{total_stamps_album} stamps in her album.
